result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison Lynn Mullen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allison Lynn Mullen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Allison Lynn Mullen was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:33 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Michelle Brekken in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court w/Allison Lynn Mullen.  Atty Chapman states agreement on record. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Ct 3. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct 3. Court dismisses Cts 1 and 2. Sentencing arguments.  Court orders: 

Count 3: 
I/S sentence of 6 months; 1 year probation with conditions, to run concurrent to other supervision:
-$243.00 Court Costs ; payable through probation
-$200 DNA Surcharge; payable through probation
